column152: that it glides down the smooth stream of comfort and convenience

column154: abounding in wealth and in all the mechanical arts

column158: they are familiar to us by long habit

column163: we find life interrupted at every turn. In our former society

column168: by long habit and pracrice and continual improvement
column169: every thing has fallen into its right place – each individual has a separate task assigned him in the joint task of labouring for the general benefit – and the industry of all
column171: tends to one common end. There is a perfect unity of effort. We all labour in common – we combine our efforts that they may yield the largest possible produce
column172: and this produce is accurately shared among the various members of the community
column173: each receiving the share to which his labour entitles him. Such is substantially the process by which commerce diffuses the benefits of industry over every civilized community. – Money is the instrument by which this division is effected. Every one who labours has the value of his labour ascertained in money
column174: which is a draft upon the common stock for whatever quantity of necessaries and luxuries he is entitled to ; and all these complicated operations are executed with a regularity almost mechanical. But in a community newly forming there is a want of unity and combination – all the members labour indeed
column175: but no one has his proper part assigned him – there is a jostling and an interference with each other – and when they come to divide
column178: of certain articles – the stock is ill assorted
column179: and money will not execute its functions. Hence disorder arises
column181: and an individual suddenly removed into this region of discomfort from the happier climate of a highly improved community

column183: fitted up with every comfort and convenience
column184: for one of inferior quality and coarsely finished
column185: where he is exposed to a thousand annoyances every minute. It is observed by Dr Johnson

column191: in the tyranny exercised over them
column193: while the corruption extends to the other orders of society
column194: equally infecting the oppressed and the oppressor
column195: and debasing the general character and habits of the people. It is vain to talk of liberty while stain of tyranny so deeply infects the domestic manners of a community. column197: that it is a practice in Kentucky to commit delinquent slaves into the hands of the public executioner
